Class Structure

java.lang.Object
Structure
public class Structure
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents a data structure based on Object List with availability function based on hash function.
Author:
Itay Shaked

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Structure​(int m, int k)
    Build Function

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addFromFile()
    gets strings from file "ObjectsToAdd.txt",divide it to "words"(objects)and adds to the structure.
    void checkFromFile()
    Gets string from "ObjectsToCheck.txt" file , divides it to "words"(objects) and checks in the byte array (which was filled by objects going through k hashFuncKBased()) if the indexes of of each word going through k hashFuncKBased() match the values in the byte array(all need to be 1 for the object to be found in the structure)
    int hashFuncKBased​(java.lang.Object input, int k)
    This function transform and object to an absolute hashCode(between 0 to Max.Integer).

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Structure

      public Structure​(int m, int k)
      Build Function
      Parameters:
      m - Size of byte array.
      k - Amount of hash functions to operate. Builds an empty list and m size byte array with all values equals to 0.

  • Method Details

    • addFromFile

      public void addFromFile()
      gets strings from file "ObjectsToAdd.txt",divide it to "words"(objects)and adds to the structure. "word" counts as one if its between ','.

      if we assume that c is the number of charcaters in the file and n is the number of words. and if we assume that a word can be not longer than c1(constant) then function runs on O(c+n*k)<=c1*O(n)+O(n*k) (k is the number of hash functions decided ny the user) therefore this function runs on O(n*k) for the worst case.

    • checkFromFile

      public void checkFromFile()
      Gets string from "ObjectsToCheck.txt" file , divides it to "words"(objects) and checks in the byte array (which was filled by objects going through k hashFuncKBased()) if the indexes of of each word going through k hashFuncKBased() match the values in the byte array(all need to be 1 for the object to be found in the structure)

    • hashFuncKBased

      public int hashFuncKBased​(java.lang.Object input, int k)
      This function transform and object to an absolute hashCode(between 0 to Max.Integer). * then it represents the equation:

      ((|x|%m)*k)%m

      whereas x is the absolute hashCode. * if we assume that hashCode runtime is O(1) then this function runtime is O(1)

      Parameters:
      input - is an Object
      k - is a variable that changes the function according to it.
      Returns:
      an Integer between 0 to m
